RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 7F Dirt CR: 73. Claiming Purse 12700. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE APRIL 7, 2023. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 7 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Wher e Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TIZ MICHELLE'S WAY took a quick lead and rated the pace inside, came under pressure leaving the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and drew away under steady handling. STYLISH PAINT stalked from the three path, bid toward the three eighths pole and raced at the rail on the far turn, proved no match for the winner and had to settle for second. FLAT DISCOUNT stalked off the rail the opening turn, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail, flattened in the lane and just lasted for third. CASTLE OF CAYLEE settled off the rail on the first turn, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and finished evenly to improve her position. URKILLINGMEBETH saved early ground, gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole and raced in the four path on the far turn, then flattened in the lane. MARKETABILITY broke a step slow and raced outside into the backstretch, gave chase from the three eighths pole but flattened in the four path on the far turn. SO RED THE ROSE was checked leaving the gate and never factored.

ENTRY.NAME: Flat Discount
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked off rail,chased 3/8,off rail far turn,just lasted 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Tiz Michelle's Way
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 3/8,rail turn,drew off driving

ENTRY.NAME: Urkillingmebeth
ENTRY.OWNER: Prostar 10 Stables Inc and The Four Horsemen Racing Stable Inc

ENTRY.NAME: Stylish Paint
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 68. Claiming Purse 11800. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Three Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SO COURAGEOUS rated the pace, came under pressure toward the quarter pole, was met midway on the turn but dug in under determined handling to recover the edge in the final yards. CHARITABLY GIFTED chased through the backstretch and took the nod midway on the turn, dug in gamely through the stretch but relented the nod in the final yards. DANCIN IN DUBAI chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the three path, dueled for third mid-stretch and was gaining on the top two. SPEIGHTS YOUR MIND chased inside, raced at the rail on the turn then flattened in the lane. TRAPPE THE GOLD gave close early chase but flattened in the four path on the turn. DINNER BELL bobbled at the break and raced briefly close while giving chase, but rounded the turn in the five path and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Charitably Gifted
ENTRY.OWNER: Shepherd Robert Phillips Jason and Harrison Glenn N
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,up mid turn,gamely lane,relented nod late

ENTRY.NAME: Dancin in Dubai
ENTRY.OWNER: Irish Hill Century Farm and McGuire Matthew

ENTRY.NAME: So Courageous
ENTRY.OWNER: Diamond Oak Stable and Splurgin Racing

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Ollie L. Figgins III & Carisa Figgins

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 70. Claiming Purse 11800. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 7 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FELICIAS CASTLE settled off the rail on the first turn, started a bid approaching the three eighths pole and raced in the three path the far turn, dug in leaving the turn and got up the final strides. MODERN DAY ROMANCE stalked off the rail, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole and raced at the rail on the far turn, dug in to match strides with SIENTE EL AMOR in the final strides and took the nod for second while outfinished for the win. The latter rated the pace inside, came under pressure nearing the three eighths pole, ran clear past the quarter, dug in under steady encouragement leaving the turn but was caught in the final strides. GET OFF MY CLOUD stalked the pace from the three path, challenged approaching the three eighths pole but dropped back past the quarter, raced off the rail on the far turn and ran evenly in the lane. CURB THAT TIGER raced in the three path the first turn, gave chase nearing the five sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail then flattened later yards. AIR MEDAL rounded the first turn off the rail, picked up the chase leaving the three eighths pole, raced in the four path on the far turn and flattened in the lane. WELL EQUIPPED saved ground off the pace, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and weakened in the stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Air Medal
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Felicias Castle
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,bid 3/8,3p far turn,up final strides

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 68. Claiming Purse 12700. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE APRIL 7, 2023. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 7 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Wher e Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).

CLAIM.OWNER: A and B Racing Stable LLC

RACE.FOOTNOTES: WILLOW MOON took over on the chute and cleared rivals while angling to the inside, came under pressure approaching the five sixteenths pole, cleared Ding Ding past the quarter pole and was kept alert to hold on well. SCARLET TANAGER steadied off the inside flank of Adabel approaching the three eighths pole, quickly recovered stride to give chase and improved in the three path on the turn, then dug in from the head of the lane to take second the final yards. DING DING closed to the heels of Willow Moon approaching the seven sixteenths pole and steadied, dug in to challenge toward the five sixteenths but dropped past past the quarter pole and flattened the final sixteenth. MAKE IT A DOUBLE gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn off the rail then flattened inside the sixteenth pole. MOJO MATTERS gave chase from well back, raced near the rail on the turn and passed rivals in the lane. GOLDEN SWEETS chased outside, rounded the turn in the six path and showed little in the lane. MISS WILD chased outside, rounded the turn about the five path and showed little in the lane. ADABEL gave chase and angled in nearing the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the turn and weakened in the stretch. The Stewards reviewed, then rejected claims of foul against the rider of Willow Moon for alleged interference soon after the start, lodged by the riders of Scarlet Tanager and Ding Ding.

ENTRY.NAME: Scarlet Tanager
ENTRY.COMMENT: steadied rail near 3/8,chased,3p turn,up 2nd final yards

ENTRY.NAME: Willow Moon
ENTRY.COMMENT: drew clear,angled in,pressured 5/16,rail turn,kept alert lane

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Libbie Eileen Thiel & John Francis Thiel

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 65. Claiming Purse 11800. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 7 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RIVERVIEW STEVIE angled to the inside and stalked through the first turn, started a bid approaching the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail, dug in to take over later yards and raced clear under the wire. HIGHWAY QUEEN rounded the first turn about the four path and was well back leaving the turn, gave chase past the seven sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and dug in to take second late yards. MIDNIGHT REGRET took over while tapering to the inside and rated the pace into the first turn, came under pressure approaching the five sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and dug in leaving the turn, but was met in later yards and flattened nearing the wire. DALLAS saved ground on the opening turn, gave chase leaving the half mile pole, raced in the three and four paths on the far turn and showed little more. HOVEL raced well back off the rail, gave chase from the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn two deep and passed some rivals. IRISH SAMURAI steadied leaving the gate, raced well off the pace in the four path the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. I B NASTY was not a factor. HOLDING COURT settled off the rail the first turn, gave chase into the backstretch then weakened in the three path on the far turn. DANCE LIGHTLY rounded the first turn about the four path then faded through the backstretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Dallas
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased 1/2,3& 4p far turn,little in lane

ENTRY.NAME: Hovel
ENTRY.OWNER: McCormick Gloria F and O'Hara Vicki

ENTRY.NAME: Riverview Stevie
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked,bid 3/8,off rail far turn,up late,clear wire

ENTRY.NAME: Highway Queen
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4p 1st turn,chased 7/16,rail far turn,dug in lane,up 2nd late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 7F Dirt CR: 90. Allowance Purse 27400. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since Sept ember 7 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since August 7 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TAP SECRET raced with the pace two deep while between horses, took the lead approaching the three eighths pole, came under pressure to widen at the rail on the far turn and held on under steady stretch handling. SILIPO was shuffled from early contention and settled well back through the opening turn, eased out into the backstretch and gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, circled rivals in the five path on the far turn and dug in to take second the final strides while gaining on the winner. ZEN MASTER saved ground on the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path then flattened later yards. FEARNOUGHT saved ground on the first turn, gave chase past the seven sixteenths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and passed some rivals. ASKIN FOR A BASKIN stalked three wide and moved to even terms approaching the seven sixteenths pole, dueled from the three eighths but dropped back past the quarter and weakened leaving the far turn. SUPER QUALITY rated close inside, gave chase toward the three eighths pole and remained a factor through the far turn before weakening. CHANGE YOUR LUCK raced with the early pace inside, was caught approaching the seven sixteenths pole, dropped back toward the five sixteenths and weakened at the rail on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Change Your Luck
ENTRY.COMMENT: with pace,caught near 7/16,weakened rail far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Fearnought
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased past 7/16,off rail far turn,passed rivals

ENTRY.NAME: Zen Master
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased 7/16,4p far turn,flattened later yards

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 68. Allowance Purse 27400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 7 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since August 7 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $ 12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GOLD FIBER became a bit anxious in the gate then gave chase through the backstretch, raced at a close disadvantage two deep on the turn but dug in under determined handling to take over in later yards. GEORGE was hustled clear while tapering to the inside and rated the pace, came under pressure approaching the quarter pole, contested the edge at the rail on the turn and dug in from the head of the stretch, but was met and relented in later yards. BORN TO SIN chased inside, raced at the rail on the turn then dueled through the stretch for third. XCELLENT START chased outside, raced three wide on the turn and was outfinished in the stretch duel for third. ONE CANDY CASTLE chased through the backstretch, raced at the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. MISSIONARY gave chase, raced two deep while between horses on the turn then flattened inside the eighth pole. DONNIE B saved ground.

ENTRY.NAME: Xcellent Start
ENTRY.OWNER: Coleswood Farm, Inc. and Raim, David

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 63. Claiming Purse 11800. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 7 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allo wed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MAKINLIMMARGARITAS took a quick lead and rated the pace inside, came under pressure approaching the five sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and dug in under steady handling to hold on. APPEALING ROAD rounded the first turn in the four path and entered the backstretch outside, gave chase approaching the three eighths pole, raced in the four path on the far turn, dug in for second past the sixteenth pole and was gaining steadily on the waning winner. ELLIES AT WINDSOR closed toward contention while tapering in and stalked the pace, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail then flattened the final sixteenth. WOODSONG'S CASTLE saved ground racing well back, picked up the chase past the seven sixteenths pole and rounded the far turn off the rail, eased out entering the stretch and finished evenly. PEARLY GHOST settled off the rail on the first turn, gave chase leaving the half mile pole and came through the far turn at the rail, though, flattened past the eighth pole. HOW IS SHE raced well back inside on the first turn, bid mildly from the five sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail and could only improve her position. I SHALLBE RELEASED raced in the four path the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. LADY SPARROW raced well back on the opening turn and was never a factor. MICHEAUX rated just off the early pace off the rail, gave chase leaving the half mile pole but faded past the three eighths.

ENTRY.NAME: Woodsong's Castle
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased 7/16,off rail far turn,even finish

ENTRY.NAME: Pearly Ghost
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,chased past 1/2,rail far turn,flattened lane

ENTRY.NAME: Makinlimmargaritas
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 5/16,rail turn,held on driving

ENTRY.NAME: How Is She
ENTRY.COMMENT: well back inside,mild bid 5/16,rail turn,improved position
